map_width: The '''Charity Commission for England and Wales''' is the non-ministerial government department that regulates registered charities in England and Wales and maintains the '''Central Register of Charities'''.  The Charity Commission answers directly to the UK Parliament rather than to Government ministers. It is governed by a board, which is assisted by the Chief Executive (currently Helen Stephenson CBE who succeeded Paula Sussex in July 2017 ) and an executive team.<ref name
